citation.abstract: Trisomy of chromosome 21 is associated with Down syndrome (DS) - the commonest genetic cause of mental retardation. We report two unusual cases with partial trisomy of chromosome 21 and tetrasomy of chromosome 21 without DS phenotype. We include a short overview of the genotype-phenotype correlation studies in discussion.
citation.journal: Biomedical Papers of the Medical Faculty of Palacky University in Olomouc
citation.title: Partial trisomy and tetrasomy of chromosome 21 without Down Syndrome phenotype and short overview of genotype-phenotype correlation. A case report.
